title: Domaine Henri Magnien 2016 Champerrier  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This perfumed wine, solid and structured, is firm with dark tannins and layers of cherry fruit underneath. It has some concentration as well as the crispness of the vintage, giving an attractive wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Dr. Thanisch Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sweet-savory traces of caramel and salt lend interest to this fresh, citrusy Riesling. Juicy lime and lemon flavors are a shade off dry but refreshing and precise. Enjoy now through 2019.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Bracing notes of tangerine and lime are peppered with pollen and crushed stones in this dry, invigorating Riesling. It's a spry, zippy wine, with a long, mineral finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Durant Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Made from Pommard clone vines planted in 1973 and 114 clone vines planted in 1993, this pumps some blueberry juiciness into the palate. No new oak was used, and it turns stiff and acidic on the finish. Give it another couple of years in bottle before opening.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Heritage No. 4 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine contains 100% Whistling Ridge Vineyard fruit, fermented with 65% whole clusters. It's tart and citrusy, with brambly berry and cola touches. There are plenty of stem and skin flavors, but the texture and length somewhat compensate. Tuck it away to revisit in the early 2020s.

title: Hawley 2013 Hawley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 13% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc, all the grapes organically grown, this red is hugely concentrated in flavors of chocolate and graham cracker. Red currant comes to the fore of a grippy chewy texture of tight-grained tannin.

title: Heinz Eifel 2016 Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle nuances of flint, smoke and blossom elevate plush, easy fruit in this surprising bang-for-your-buck auslese. It's irresistibly fruity and forward, chock full of unctuous apricot and peach flavors, but sprightly and sheen too. The finish lingers on sweet honeyed.

title: Howard Park 2014 Flint Rock Shiraz (Great Southern)
description: Richer in style, this shows ripe blackberry, mocha, black pepper, warm stones and vanilla oak on the nose. The palate is plush in fruit and savory tannins, while the oak is a little apparent but not overpowering. Drink now–2022.

title: Jackfall 2012 Cabernet Franc (Villány)
description: This Cabernet Franc has aromas of smoked charcuterie and black plum, leading to dark fruit flavors and a touch of freshly ground black pepper. The finish is balanced, with a touch of minerality.

title: L'Angolo 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A difficult wine to analyze, this at first seems dilute. With ample breathing, it fills in and spreads out, showing mineral notes and raspberry and pomegranate fruit. The astringent, tongue-drying finish calls for pairing with a hearty, meaty entrée.

title: Martín Códax 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas are fresh and zippy on the nose. An alert, agile palate is citrusy but not sharp. Flavors of apple, nectarine and apricot finish with length, clarity and brightness. Drink now.

title: Monteci 2013  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
description: Inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, baked plum and cooking spice come together on this. It's concentrated and smooth, doling out mature blackberry, white pepper and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Moorooduc 2015 Chardonnay (Mornington Peninsula)
description: Cashew, buttered toast, lemon and smoke abound on this estate wine. The slippery textured palate still indicates this Chardonnay's youth, with the oak a little bitter and prominent, but all elements are in place for this to come into its own soon. Drink now–2025.

title: Mr. Riggs 2015 Three Corner Jack Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Red (McLaren Vale)
description: Plush red and dark fruit, licorice, florals, olives and dusty oak make up this powerful blend of Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The palate feels a little on the hot, oaky side, but then finishes on a pleasing savory, olive note. One for the big red lovers. Drink now–2025.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2016 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Prominent in its wood aging, this tannic wine also shows plenty of juicy red-currant and red-berry fruits. It is spicy and toasty at the moment. Give it time, and drink from 2026.

title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 L'Olivier  (Fixin)
description: Ripe, juicy and packed with red-berry fruits, this is an immediately attractive wine. With its rich texture and already well-integrated tannins, it is a generous wine that is ready to drink.

title: Plumb Cellars 2013 Estate JK Vineyard IV Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Co-fermented with Viognier, this shows high-toned raspberry, cherry and spice aromas and full-bodied red fruit flavors, with meaty notes on the finish. It has a pleasant balance.

title: Renwood 2014 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Big but balanced, this wine from one of Amador's higher elevation districts. It has a nice deep color, spicy sweet oak aromatics and generous juicy fruit flavors backed by moderate tannins and full body.

title: Rocca Sveva 2013  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and cooking spice while the juicy palate delivers red plum, clove and black pepper. Smooth tannins lend polish. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Scheid Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Sugar-cured grapefruit rinds, sour Granny Smith apple slices and wet concrete show on the nose of this bottling from one of the larger growers in Monterey. Green apple skins mix with guava, passion fruit and green grass flavors on the palate, which is lifted by white pepper.

title: Schloss Vollrads 2016 Volratz Dry Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Ripe yellow peach and tangerine flavors are juicy and thirst quenching in this dry, easygoing wine. A touch of spice and zesty lime acidity keeps the midpalate vibrant, extending into a brisk but pristine finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Tedeschi 2016 Lucchine  (Valpolicella)
description: This opens with aromas of cassis, underbrush and white pepper. The light-bodied, savory palate delivers red cherry, raspberry compote and star anise alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2015 Calderara Sottana Bianco  (Etna)
description: Subdued aromas suggest toasted nut, crushed stone and a whiff of pressed yellow flower. The linear palate offers yellow apple, ripe pear, tangerine zest and mineral, while a note of bitter almond closes the finish.

title: Thorn Clarke 2016 Eden Trail Riesling (Eden Valley)
description: Aromas of flowers, peaches, blossoms and a hint of honey lead into a palate that's more about apples and limes. This is straightforward and precise in its appeal. Drink now–2028.

title: Valentina Cubi 2014 Iltabarro  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)
description: Made with organic grapes, this boasts aromas of red currant, tobacco and cooking spice. The light-bodied, savory palate delivers red cherry, raspberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Weisinger 2016 Gold Vineyard Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)
description: This is a bright and lively wine, with fresh, lightly spicy Asian pear flavors. The citrusy acidity brings a touch of pineapple, too. It was aged in 10% new French oak, which seems just right.

title: Wine by Joe 2016 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: This wine's easygoing juicy green apple fruit is highlighted with cilantro and a generous squeeze of lime. Crisp, fresh and widely available, it's a fine, all-purpose quaffing white.

title: Winzer Von Erbach 2016 Erbacher Honigberg Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Bursts of sweet-tart tangerine, yellow peach and grapefruit flavors are juxtaposed by hints of earth tones and vivacious acidity in this wine. Medium sweet in style, this is a well-balanced spätlese offering both easy, juicy fruit and a racy, invigorating edge. Drink now through 2021.

title: Xanadu 2015 DJL Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: With plenty of swirling in glass this broody wine reveals its character: Ripe blackberries and red currant, chocolate, tar, mint and other herbs mingle with toasty oak notes on the nose. The tannins on the palate are dusty and tightly wound and woven into more tar and savory herbal characters. The oak is fairly prominent now but there's an elegance to this medium-bodied wine that will take it to nice heights in the future. Drink now–2027.

title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2014 Natasha Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Smoky, toasty aromas introduce this wine before progressing into an interesting mix of flavors based around raspberry jam. Streaks of bitter herb, tarragon and citrus wind through, with a butterscotch hint that brightens the finish.
